page.title: 05SCHOOLS Upper School
page.content: The Great Cornard Upper School was opened in September 1973. The children leave at 18 years old and they can go to college or university or get a job. There are 7,500 books in the library and they hope to get more books. There are 1,200 teenagers in the school. There were 400 teenagers in 1973. They have detention from 30 minutes to an hour. There are 4 houses-Grey,Wakelin, Howard and Brandon. There are more men than women teachers. The headmaster is Mr Pickford, the two deputies are Mr Knight and Miss Howarth. They have English,Foreign Languages,Maths, History,Geography,Science,Creative Design and Games. There are 6 blocks in the school.The Prospect Theatre was opened in 1981 and there are 250 seats. They have children from Great Cornard Middle School and Stoke by Nayland.
